column4: I'd like to try to get my Handspring Treo 300 working with ubuntu, anyone have any tips? it just freezes whenever I try to sync it via usb cable
I had the same problem with edgy, but got it to work with dapper (Palm TX)
I'm in dapper now, and i believe there are subtle differences between handspring and palm that just won't let it work right
btw, I had fewer troubles with wireless network hotsync than with the USB/cradle connection
how does that work?  you mean via infrared?
no, by wireless I mean WLAN according to IEEE 802.11b
i cannot connect my treo to wlan... just phone networks (disabled) and usb.  No slots either
what stage does it get to before it crashes?
but I do have an infrared usb adapter... you may have helped me more than you know
right at the start of the sync
well, IR can be a can of worms, too...
ends up needing a hard reset via the pinhole in the back
oh, it's the Treo crashing, not ubuntu?
can you please read and follow up the information that ubotu sent you, and only ask if something is left unclear on these pages.
check out 'man chown', it'll tell you that it's user:group (ubuntu has a group for each user by default)
yes. You'll have fewer problems with 32bits even.
